And if they don't fire him and all you want is the money and the police won't do anything, how is he gonna know he's wrong? You can't take the deal, Abigail! It wasn't so you could get any money, it was because we wanted to get him fired! It doesn't matter about the money! You wouldn't have gotten it before!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well it may not matter to you, but where I come from three hundred and fifty thousand dollars is an awful lot of money, and to my mind is a positive result of all this tragedy and not just negative. Not just getting someone fired for one mistake, no matter how bad it was -- LISA Oh SHOVE IT UP YOUR ASS! She knocks the speaker phone off the desk and runs to the door in floods of tears.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lisa!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You sleazy fucking lawyer! And you're a moralistic cunt! She runs out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . STREET. DAY. 168 TRACKING in front of Lisa as she walk-runs down the busy street. A city bus appears behind her and goes by. She cranes to see the driver. It's not her guy. She keeps going.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . SCHOOL. DAY. 169 Lisa stands against a car, smoking, as the kids flow out of the building. Mr Aaron comes out, talking with BONNIE, the gymnastics teacher. They walk away from the school together. Lisa catches up with them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey, Lisa. What's Up? - LISA Hey, did you guys know I had an abortion last week? Pause.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No. I didn't know that.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah, it cost four hundred dollars.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Um, should I...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, no, don't go anywhere.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah, don't go anywhere. Bonnie doesn't know what to make of this. Mr Aaron looks steadily at Lisa.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Do you want to tell us about it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah. I do.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . -Go ahead.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well... She doesn't speak. Pause.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Do your parents know about this, Lisa?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : 169 LISA Yes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Have you told the father, honey?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No...There's a couple of people it could be.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I think you better tell them. Whoever they are.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No...No...Never mind ...I'm sure he's sorry anyway, whichever one he is.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't see what difference that makes, if he's sorry. And I think whoever it is should know about this.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm sorry. I shouldn't have brought this up. Please don't tell anyone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We're not gonna tell anyone. But you're gonna have to tell whoever it could be -- LISA (On have to") That's OK. I gotta go. Thanks for listening. It's -- It doesn't matter about the father, because the whole thing was my fault. I'm sorry...! She shakes her head and runs away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What was that...?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . COHEN APARTMENT. DAY. 170 Lisa comes in. Curtis is doing his homework at the table.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mom's looking for you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What for?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She thinks you're going out with her tonight.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : 170 LISA Where are we going?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't know. Lisa heads for her room. Joan appears, half-dressed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lisa? Honey? Did you forget we're going to the opera?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I didn't-remind you because I didn't want to nag you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's OK.

direction.raw_text: . BROADWAY -- NEAR LINCOLN CENTER. DUSK. 171 Lisa starts to cross the street against the light. Joan takes her arm.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't get run over. A cab rattles by. Lisa looks down the street. A BUS is approaching.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Wait. I want to see if that's him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What. They wait. The bus gets closer, heading straight toward them and stops at the bus stop. Lisa grabs her mother's arm.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It is him. Mom, that's the one... Joan and Lisa look at him. He's staring out ahead of him as people board the bus. He SEES Lisa and Joan but can't see their faces and doesn't recognize Lisa: He just sees two dolled-up women under the street light. He smiles dazzling at them and drives past with a short wave. Joan looks at Lisa. She looks like she's about to throw up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Come on. We're gonna miss the curtain.
direction.name: direction
